metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9281 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the HTML Data Processor forCKEditor 4.0 before 4.14 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary webscript through a crafted "protected" comment (with the cke_protectedsyntax).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9281` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ckeditor - 4.5.7+dfsg-2ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.5.7+dfsg-2ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm1').
